scraped_reviews.content: I've had this game for years and I've always loved how simple and endless the puzzles were, but this past year the ads have gotten out of control. There are ads when I first open the app, then again when I start a level, 2min mandatory ads after passing a level, temu ads that automatically open up my browser,and random ads in the middle of a level without prompting. If this is going to continue, I will uninstall the game and find a new one.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for your feedback. We are sorry to hear about your experience with the ads. After a few seconds from the beginning of a video ad, an option to skip the ad must appear: a fast forward or a cross-shaped button. If you cannot close the ads or they redirect you to browser, please contact us via the "Help" in the app. We'll be happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: FAR too many ads, long ones, too. I enjoy the puzzles and will probably keep the app a while longer, but it's almost an ad in between every single game. also, if you're playing on the hardest setting, it's easy to hit a wrong square and when you run out of the 3 given mistakes, it's an ad for every single mistake after. it's almost unbearable to the point I would delete the app, but not quite, hence the 2nd star on the app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! We appreciate your feedback about the ads. We understand that balancing revenue generation and user experience is essential. Please know that we are always working to improve the experience, and your input will help us refine how ads are presented, ensuring they remain unobtrusive while supporting the app‚Äôs development.

scraped_reviews.content: ETA: while the devs responded with a solution for my initial issue, they have not responded to the many people complaining that to unlock the daily puzzle, you have to complete up to 100 levels, and that if you do even one extra level one day, let alone many to complete an event, the number jumps way up. This should be capped at 15-20 MAX and preferably randomize each day rather than be based on how many you did the previous day. Every time I go over, I stop playing for months until it goes down
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for sharing your feedback. We're sorry if the tasks caused any frustration. The tasks for unlocking a Secret level depend on your average activity in the app. We appreciate your feedback and will consider it while working on improving 'Today's Goals'. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: 1. Emoji reactions when you finish rows now aren't disabled by removing ads. Distracting and annoying. 2. Daily goals rise based on activity and don't lower until you fail, easily reaching a point where an hour+ is REQUIRED per day, even if cheesing on easy. 3. It's way too easy to mark unintended squares, esp on Hard+, even using a stylus. There's no way to zoom, so Expert is unplayable on a phone. 4. There's no way to transfer progress between devices. New phone = start over.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We understand that the new emojis can be distracting. The option to turn them off is not available at the moment. We've noted your feedback about tasks for 'Today's Goal', zoom feature and progress transfer, and will keep this in mind while working on future updates. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: All ads. Open the app, ad. Start a puzzle, ad. Finish a puzzle, ad. Between sections of a puzzle, ad. And they're almost all three page ads that randomly open the product like you clicked on it when you never touched the screen at all. The slider to change from X to Fill randomly doesn't change. Using a stylus I can see when I touch a square and it decides I touched a different one. I don't have these issues with any other app or game.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry you're experiencing trouble! Please kindly contact us through the Help in the app or at support@easybrain.com so we can investigate and resolve the issue. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Fun game, but the developers are committing cardinal sins with their advertisements. Ads pop up when I first open it, ads pop up in the middle of games, sometimes the game will send me off the app to a random advertiser's website, even if I haven't clicked anything. Ads also sometimes come as videos where the exit button won't display until you tap the screen; which takes you to the advertiser sometimes, too! Each ad requires you to click three different exit buttons! Ugh! Please fix.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for your feedback. We are sorry to hear about your experience with the ads. If you cannot close the ads or they redirect you to other websites, please contact us via the "Help" in the app. We'll be glad to look deeper into your issue.

scraped_reviews.content: The game is fun and engaging, but having to watch or skip through multi stage advertisements every 3 or 4 moves is fricking annoying. You spend more time in ad mode than in solving the puzzle. some of the adds open up the Play store app so you have to close that app to get back to the puzzle. I didn't say the ads are unskippable, I said you have to skip multiple stages of the ads. The ads that do this the most are the game ads for other games on Play.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello. Thank you for reporting the problem! Please accept our apologies for the negative experience with ads in our app. Could you please take a screenshot of such an ad and send it to us via "Help" in the app? This would let us block the problem ad for good. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Decent puzzle game. It adds variety through events, but you don't have to participate. Unfortunately, it hides the expert levels and won't present them unless you change the default settings. Also, because the squares are so small, it is more difficult for an adult to play on a phone rather than a tablet.

It was fun until recently. They always had 2 nonogram events going, so I could pick the one I enjoy most. they usually had a reward event going also that depended on how many nonogram puzzles I solved. Then they added water sort as one of the reward events, and the second nonogram event disappeared. So now, I only have one choice of events. The current one has way too many easy puzzles, and the hard ones are often easier than I like.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thanks for your feedback. We do not remove any of our challenges, we only add new ones. Please note that all challenges start according to schedule, and when a challenge expires, it can take a few days for the next one to start. Feel free to contact us via the "Help" section if you have any questions!

scraped_reviews.content: The app now forces you into "challenges" when all of this type of content used to be optional, I can't find any option to just continue into the next normal level. Also, now going on 4 years later with the same battery-draining white as the main theme with no dark mode to conserve power. Not sure why they keep saying "maybe eventually" instead of just saying "No, we're not doing that"
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy Special Levels. The option to disable these levels is not available. We hear your desire for a dark mode. For now, please try the following: Settings ‚Üí Display ‚Üí Night Light (Pixel/stock). Some devices call it Reading Mode or Eye Comfort. Most devices also offer extra dimming in Accessibility settings.

scraped_reviews.content: the game itself is fun, but the ads are so pervasive that they almost force you to pay for no ads. an ad after every puzzle, ads transitioning from different menus, ads when opening the app. uninstalling. if the ads weren't so crazy, I'd consider paying for ad-free, but as it stands the app feels like paying for ad-free is a requirement to use it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We understand your disappointment with the number of ads disrupting your enjoyment. Your feedback is important, and we're sorry to hear that it led to your decision to delete the app. We appreciate you sharing your thoughts and hope you might consider giving it another try in the future!

scraped_reviews.content: okay love this game but the short ad after every level is annoying.would love to be able to zoom in because even with a stylus I hut the wrong square. still fun. frustrating but an enjoyable time killer. update. not complaining about ads since I know they help keep the game free. but after every level seems excessive even if they are only 8 seconds. REALLY do now like having 2 ads in the middle of a hard level and completely blowing my concentration. again love this game.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for sharing your feedback. Currently, we don‚Äôt offer a zoom feature, but we understand its value and will consider adding it in future updates. We hear your concerns about the ads interrupting your gameplay, and we will search for a better balance between ads and gaming. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I really enjoyed playing this game, but the update that added animated emojis has nearly ruined it. They pop up in the middle of the puzzle at seemingly random times. I don't think the emojis add anything positive to my playing experience and would like to get rid of them. Update: I changed to 5 stars because they moved the emojis to the top of the screen and away from the puzzle!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for your feedback. We're sorry to hear that our recent changes made the game less enjoyable for you. Unfortunately, at the time there's no option to turn off emoji, but we will consider your feedback while working on new updates. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Every week that "Rise & Dice" shows up on the game, I love to play it. but when I land on a gift to get extra dice I don't get it. I lose dice several times every week when I play. I'm getting tired of not receiving my gifts dice. If this happens again I will uninstall the game. Please fix the issue.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for getting in touch with us. In the "Rise and Dice" challenge, receiving a gift can provide additional rolls or hints. When you get a gift, please look at the pop-up message. If you see a light bulb icon, that means that the gift is additional hints. Feel free to contact us via the "Help" section if you have any questions.

scraped_reviews.content: I love this game more than I've ever loved any game before. Perhaps it's because it is tough enough to stump me, but logical enough that I always eventually succeed. My suggestion to the developers would be to reduce the celebration time after a win, or at least make it so we can click buttons mid-confetti. I also vastly prefer the Water Sort mini-game over the Rise-and-Dice because sometimes I get stuck in endless portal loops, and it makes me so frustrated that I uninstall the game for a bit.

EDIT: lol I didn't get video ads until after I left this review L U H M A O The game prompted me to rate and I had just lost a puzzle so I clicked 1-4 stars from the annoyance. But a few puzzles later I realized, I hadn't seen ANY ads. That sort of thing is practically unheard of these days. I play games constantly on one of those gift card earning apps. And ads are so egregious now. Love this game, love that I don't have to see a video ad every 4 minutes.

Love the puzzles, but I wish there was a way to choose the level of difficulty. I only enjoy the harder ones. The easy & medium levels are so easy that the Ads between them take longer than the puzzles. I dont participate in the events because there are too many easy levels & event rewards are hints, which I don't need. EDIT: Being able to change difficulty rating makes all the difference! rating increased to 5!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for your feedback! We're sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy our new 4 in 1 Special Levels. Please note that we provide an option to choose the difficulty. Open the app, go to Settings, choose "Game Mode," and enable the "Choose Difficulty" option. Then you'll be able to choose the difficulty level.

scraped_reviews.content: I've finished every daily since the game came out and got a lot of the trophies and art from the monthly games but this new thing where I can't hit continue for 15 seconds after each game is driving me crazy. Why does it have to count the dice and then wait and then drop the page down before I can hit continue and go to the next puzzle. I finish some puzzles quicker than it takes the game to let me move on to the next puzzle. This needs to be fixed quickly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns about the recent changes to the game and apologize for any inconvenience caused. We currently do not have the option to disable animations, but we want you to know that your feedback is valuable to us and will be taken into account as we continue to improve the game.

scraped_reviews.content: I would give 5 stars but when I play on expert mode, there's no way to zoom in so when I'm trying to click one of the very tiny squares, the one next to it gets clicked causing me to lose a life. the update after you finish a puzzle and you have to wait for everything to load before you can go to the next level is a little annoying. other than that, relaxing
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We appreciate you taking the time to share your experience! It's fantastic to know that you found the game engaging and enjoyable, and your insights will help guide our future updates and improvements. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Overall a great app. I've had this app for years but decided to write this review now because of a recent update. In the events, when a "postcard" is completed, a short animated loop is played. That animation is now very obviously AI generated, making it creepy and sloppy looking. I'd appreciate it if Nonogram goes back to using charming human-made animations!

It's incredibly annoying when I go to press the correct box and it takes a heart away because apparently my below average sized fingers are too big for the boxes. I have ran out of lives too many times when they weren't even actual mistakes. there needs to be an option to make notes or something. im sure im not the only one who thinks this way.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for your feedback. We have a classic game mode, where you can edit the game field freely and "Undo" your moves. To activate it, open Settings, choose "Game Mode" and tap "Classic Mode". Please let us know if you encounter any difficulties via "Help" in the app.

scraped_reviews.content: Leaving the game üò¢ after a long time playing this game for stress relief, going through so many ups and downs, this game has decided to add animations to minimize us from playing too fast! I'm not sure what's the strategy there, but with the stress it gives me, I have to uninstall. Maybe in the future I'll come back and it has gotten better ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns about the recent changes to the game and apologize for any inconvenience caused. We currently do not have the option to disable animations, but we want you to know that your feedback is valuable to us and we're considering it for the next update.

scraped_reviews.content: Pretty fun game overall, but trying for the tournaments is a waste of time. There's always cheaters that accrue over 1,500 stars in less than an hour, which shouldn't be possible. Nothing seems to be done about the hackers either. I chased a cheater once, and every time I get close to passing them, they jump ahead by 500 or so. Not really great.

Update. staying at 1 star. was able to put up with the ads after 3 errors, even when the system ra randomly selected whatever block it wanted to causing me to go into an ad. Now there are random ads that pop in (IN THE MIDDLE OF PLAY) SCREW THIS. I'm of with someone making .oney with ads, but this in the point I delete and find new app. been playing for years. shows how greedy.. Had this game on my other phone, my phone battery exploded rendering my phone useless, no way to get my status back.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We understand your disappointment with the number of ads disrupting your enjoyment. Your feedback is important, and we're sorry to hear that it led to your decision to delete the app. We appreciate you sharing your thoughts and hope you might consider giving it another try in the future!

scraped_reviews.content: edit: it looks like the animations have been updated, and i can play at the pace i like again! original review left for posterity, but updating rating. the new animations are so slow, that it's actually faster to close and reopen the game after each completed puzzle, rather than wait for the new animations to play. it's such a drag, and makes me not want to play during events. please add an option to disable animations.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns about the recent changes to the game and apologize for any inconvenience caused. We currently do not have the option to disable animations, but we want you to know that your feedback is valuable to us and will be taken into account as we continue to improve the game.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been playing this game for years, and it's been consistently great. Literally zero performance issues. Haven't been enjoying updates lately, though. Main complaint: additions that disrupt gameplay. Childish emoji interruptions of encouragement in the middle of a game. Dice earned needs an extended animation at the end of every level now? I just want to play seamlessly, without getting tripped up by these annoyances.

Love this app and love these kinds of puzzles, but the ads are ridiculous. There aren't many when you first start, but the more you play, the more frequent the ads. After playing a while, I'm now having to watch an ad before every single puzzle. I get there being ads, but when there's as much ad as gameplay, I'm out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We appreciate your feedback about the ad frequency. Balancing ads and gameplay is important to us, and your input helps us understand how it impacts your experience. Thank you for sharing your thoughts, and we hope you continue to find joy in the puzzles!

scraped_reviews.content: I enjoy this game so much that I, the ultimate tightwad, paid for the ad-free version of it! It's been my nightly go-to to unwind. I love the daily challenges, and even the other games that solving puzzles gets you chances to play! I also really appreciate the high-contrast display. (Meow Tower, by comparison, is adorable, but not the easiest to see clearly.) If I had one request, it would be for a dark mode feature, with the same degree of contrast. Thanks for a fun and engaging puzzle game!

The smaller puzzles play great, but large puzzles are too small for a phone. Worse yet, the adverts are relentless and many can't be dismissed even after 30 seconds. I spent more time trying to exit ads and dismissing Play Store pop-ups than playing the game. I won't pay for an ad-free version when the developers are responding to complaints from its ad-supported user base with vaguely apologetic platitudes. I wish them financial success, but it won't come from me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for sharing your experience. Ads for additional lives and hints can be closed after 30 seconds. All other ads should have an option to skip after a few seconds. If you cannot skip the ads, please contact us via the "Help" section inside the app and send a screenshot of this ad. We'll make sure to check it. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: This is one of my favorite games but over the years the ads have gotten crazy...even if it's a short puzzle that takes 10 seconds you get an ad after EVERY puzzle. And some of these ads (like stupid Temu) you can't seem to click the 'X' when it's time it just redirects you to the app/website. I understand the need for ads but very annoying and excessive
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thank you for reporting this issue! We're sorry to hear that you saw such ads in our app. Could you please contact us via the 'Help' in the app and send a screenshot of this ad? We'll make sure to block it. Thank you in advance!

scraped_reviews.content: This game started off nice as just a strategy game and then slowly but surely began to bombard me with notifications and "events" after pretty much every board (most of which were giveaways) you would get a ad and often this ad would not give you a x and you would just have to restart the app. They tried to make an old, enjoyable, and simplistic yet challenging game into some kind crapfest. If you are looking for some enjoyable nonagram go elsewhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts. We are sorry to hear about your experience. After a few seconds from the beginning of a video ad, an option to skip the ad must appear: a fast forward or a cross-shaped button. If there's no such button, please contact us via the "Help" in the app. We'll be happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: pop up emojis are very annoying. I've lost my flow over and over because they pop up, cover the center of the puzzle, and stay there for a few seconds, and you can't even click them away. It's annoying and unnecessary, and ridiculous that there's no option to turn it off. It feels like it's farming game time, by making the puzzles take just a few seconds longer per pop up. Also, I've turned off internet for this app. You shall not collect my data
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We understand that the new emojis can be distracting. Currently, there isn't an option to turn them off, but we've noted your concerns and will consider this for future updates. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: Has been an interesting game, something a little different. but around level 59-60, when pressing the correct key. it reacts as if it's a wrong key, then asks if you want to watch a video to continue or restart the game. When I opt to continue, I notice the key I pressed that the game said was wrong will be blacked out. I'm sure it's just a glitch, but I'm giving 3 stars in case it's another marketing scam.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for your feedback. The issue you described happens when the switch button at the bottom is in the wrong position. Before making a move please make sure that the switch button is in the right mode. If you have any questions, please contact us through the 'Help' in the app. We'll be happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: I really enjoy this app, but the one thing I find a little frustrating are the event modes. Unless you have a ton of free time, it is near impossible to complete the event. I get its for achievement purposes, but even as someone seasoned with Nanograms/Picross I can barely find enough time to finish one. Maybe consider cutting the required puzzles by 1/3 at least? If this were to ever be addressed I would increase to 5 stars.

Always loved Nonograms/Pictograms. I'm not very far in this app but in the five days I've played I have two minor complaints. I would love it if I could switch the background to dark mode. I often play at night and the light background is a bit bright. Second is the random emoji pop-ups with messages like "way to go" or "awesome", I think they are a bit much so an option to disable them freely would be nice.

I genuinely loved this app and would've given 4 or 5 stars, but as of today, I've started getting TWO ads every other puzzle, and that's absolutely ridiculous. It literally says "Ad 1 of 2" on the bottom like it's a YouTube video. I understand that people need to be paid, but changing to a two-part ad system literally overnight is absurd.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! We're sorry to hear that you're experiencing too many ads in our app. We understand that ads can be frustrating, but they help us keep the app free for everyone to use. However, we'll take your feedback into consideration and try to improve the ad experience in future updates. Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: There's about 6000 levels before you start repeating, but that doesn't include dailies, event puzzles, or expert levels. After 2-3 years of doing these I still have puzzles to start my day. The ad rate was a little annoying, but it was only like $2 to get rid of them, so it's not all that bad.

Personally I love this type of puzzle and EasyBrain has made a great way to play them. I play every day and do every tournament from start to finish. I have done all the daily levels and now if I want to play I do the expert levels which I love for the added difficulty. However, the lack of a zoom ability makes the game nearly unplayable on the expert levels because the box's are too small to click. This has been an issue for years and there still isn't any solution. Please add Zoom!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for your feedback! We're sorry for this inconvenience and will consider adding a zoom feature in the future. Stay tuned for our updates!

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely LOVE this game!! It is my favorite 'mindless', time-killing game to click when I have a few mins. In terms of the GAME, I'd give it 10 stars. The problem is that the game doesn't always save my progress! After exiting the game and coming back, it'd start me over. Sometimes when I click off the game during the Xtra life ad, the board is clear & game starts over when I return. It is so frustrating. Makes me not want to play unless I have unlimited time. S23 ultra
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for writing a review. We are sorry to hear about your experience! Could you please contact us through the 'Help' in the app at your earliest convenience? We'll be glad to look deeper into your issue. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I came back to edit my review. My opinion dropped from 5 stars down to 3 because of the ads. I normally don't mind ads, but lately some of the ads don't function at all. The screen will go blank as tho an ad is about to start, but then nothing happens. And it stays like this...just a black screen with my only option being to exit the game and reopen. However, when I go back in, I then have to watch more ads, and I've usually lost my progress the puzzle. Very frustrating.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for writing a review. We are sorry to hear about your experience! Could you please contact us through the 'Help' in the app at your earliest convenience? We'll do our best to solve this problem.

scraped_reviews.content: The game itself is amazing! BUT!!! There are a ridiculous amount of ads. If you are doing well, there's an ad, if you make a mistake, there's an ad. And the ads are mostly long ads. Sometimes, the boxes are so small I accidentally hit the wrong square so I end up having to sit through more ads than I get to actually play the game!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for taking the time to share your opinion. We understand you, but as our app is free, ads give us the opportunity to support the app, optimize and improve it. Please note that there is an option in the Settings menu to remove ads from the app. If you have any queries, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at support@easybrain.com.

scraped_reviews.content: I loved it, the game is stressing when you play it in a hardcore way when you decide not to use any cross or the less, the better, but it gives you a lot of calm when you end each level and see the picture. Also it became so addicting when you end a level and decide to try "another one" and then realize it's 1AM. The reason why I'm giving 4 stars is because my progress wasn't saved, so I've lost those 127 hints I had (and I rarely used), throphies and months completed. I had fun :(
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thanks for your feedback. Unfortunately, the feature to save your progress is currently not available in the app. But we'll definitely consider adding it in the future. Please stay tuned for our updates!

scraped_reviews.content: Fun game, but the ads are a bit excessive. Yes, I know I can skip them after a few seconds and yes, I know I could pay to remove the ads and yes, I know the developers need to make money, but I am very low income and can't afford to pay for no ads on games. I don't mind ads in my games, but an ad after every single picture is becoming annoying.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! We are sorry ads bother you. We always try to keep balance with ads and provide the best experience for our users, but please keep in mind there is an option in the Settings menu to remove ads from the app. If you require any further information, you can reach us through the Help in the app where we'll be on hand to assist you!

scraped_reviews.content: It's a fun game and I really like it. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because there isn't an option to zoom in and make the squares bigger. So I lose almost every time because the squares are so tiny, my finger hits the wrong square. So I'm deleting it and searching for a game like it but that is hopefully set up better where you can zoom to hit the correct squares.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Thanks for your feedback. We're looking into the possibility of developing a zoom feature, but can't name any exact timeline of when it will be ready. Thanks again for writing in and apologies that we didn't have better immediate news for you.

scraped_reviews.content: would give this game a five if it weren't for 2 things. 1. too many ads! i get the devs need money but it's excessive to the point i want to delete the app. 2. not enough hearts. 3 hearts aren't enough for the more difficult levels. i personally think each difficulty should add 1 heart. overall fun, but these two major issues are tedious and annoying.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Apologies for interrupting your game with ads. We'll work towards making your experience more enjoyable. If you've run out of lives, you can easily get additional ones. Just tap the 'Get More Lives' button and then watch one short ad. If you have any other questions, let us know and we‚Äôll be happy to help.

scraped_reviews.content: Good game but interrupts with too many ads. Edit: I guess it's annoying that the ads interrupt the flow. Other methods/games have a set number of free games/credits per period and the ads are voluntarily started if additional rounds are desired. After each game is a bit much. Yes, I understand that ad free is available for a nominal fee... but i don't know if the puzzles become intriguing later because i hit a pay/ad wall quickly. So, again, the games I did play are good, the app works as advertised (hence the 3 stars), but the fast ad wall uninspired me (which is why I no longer play it and uninstalled). Other games, i freely click on starting ads of my own volition because they engage me enough to where I want to continue. This particular implementation is cumbersome with involuntary/mandatory ads. If the game added challenges or personal goals, that would probably add a star, two if it becomes addictive. But alas, i'm not inspired to purchase, hence stuck at 3 stars for me. My suggestion: First 20 games or so free (get me addicted), then 3-5 games free per day with ads for more. Perhaps more challenging puzzles cost more free plays. 1 credit for easy games, 2 for medium, 3 for hard, etc. The pixel art is not inspiring (at least the first few ones I did play). Now if you took several puzzles and they interlocked to create a larger picture, that would be a reasonably interesting challenge and could inspire. That could cause people to spend more clicks for ads to get to that end goal faster... or to pay up front for the ad free version. Anyhow, hope you take this as constructive criticism to make your app better.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi! Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. Please know that we value your review and suggestions. We are running our users' wishlist and doing our best to improve our app and make it an enjoyable one. We'll consider your suggestions while working on future versions of the app. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I wish there was some sort of "confirmation system" before using hints. Maybe a little pop-up asking if you're sure that you want to use it? I had a bunch of hints saved up from the Christmas and Valentine's Day events, but I must have misclicked and used almost all of them on accident since over half of them are gone. It's so easy to click on the hint button without realizing it until it's too late! If a safeguard like this is implemented, I'd rate five stars since it's a very fun game üíú
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for your feedback! We're sorry for this inconvenience and will keep this in mind for future improvements. Stay tuned for our future updates!

scraped_reviews.content: Ad hell. You spend more time ignoring ads than you do solving the ludicrously easy "puzzles". Edit: after taking their reply into account, it's still ad hell. SOME ads give you skip or close options but not all of them. Besides that, they're so frequent, even if you could skip them, you'd still spend at least as much time on ads as you would with the puzzle. You do have the option to stop the ads, for a not marginal fee. I'm not against ad supported software, just software supported ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello! Sorry about interrupting your game with ads. We understand that it must be unpleasant, and we'll try to make ads less disturbing. If you cannot skip the ads, please contact us via the 'Help' section inside the app.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great game and semi addictive. There are a few things I wish would be improved though. 1. The game board is so small, there should be a zoom feature so you don't click in the wrong cell by mistake. It would also help for those of us with bad vision to see the numbers clearly. 2. The star bonuses look too much like an X and are difficult to see. They should be changed to highlighted squares so you don't miss them as an open cell. Or removed altogether as they add no value.

It's a fun little time-wasting game which, at times, can even get addictive. Some of the drawings are a bit of a stretch, and some of them are outright silly, which also makes for a good laugh (Especially the animal ones). The event based puzzles with the animated cards are very fun and always give a reason to come back to the game. Overall, I am satisfied with the app.

title: Strava: Run, Bike, Hike
description: Join over 180 million active people on Strava ‚Äì the free app where building community meets fitness tracking. Whether you're a world-class athlete or just starting out, Strava has your back the entire journey. Here's how: Track your growth ‚Ä¢ Record It All: Running, cycling, walking, hiking, yoga. You can record all those activities ‚Äì plus over 40 other sport types. If it's not on Strava, it didn‚Äôt happen. ‚Ä¢ Connect Your Favorite Apps and Devices: Sync with thousands of devices like Apple Watch, Garmin, Fitbit and Peloton ‚Äì you name it. The Strava Wear OS app includes a tile and a complication you can use to quickly launch activities. ‚Ä¢ Understand Your Progress: Get data insights to see how you're improving over time. ‚Ä¢ Compete on Segments: Show off your competitive streak. Race against others on segments to the top of the leaderboards and become the King or Queen of the Mountain. Find and connect with your crew ‚Ä¢ Build a Support Network: Take the Strava community offline and meet in real life. Use the Clubs feature to join local groups or create your own. ‚Ä¢ Join and Create Challenges: Participate in monthly challenges to chase new goals, collect digital badges and stay motivated while encouraging others. ‚Ä¢ Stay Connected: Your Strava feed is filled with real efforts from real people. Follow friends or your favorite athletes and send kudos to celebrate every win (big and small). Move with confidence ‚Ä¢ Move Safer with Beacon: Share your real-time location with loved ones for an extra layer of safety during your activities. ‚Ä¢ Control your privacy: Adjust who can see your activities and personal data. ‚Ä¢ Edit Map Visibility: Hide the beginning or end points of your activities. Get even more with a Strava subscription ‚Ä¢ Discover Routes Anywhere: Get intelligent route recommendations with popular routes based on your preferences and location, or create your own bike routes and footpaths using our Routes tool. ‚Ä¢ Live Segments: Receive real-time updates on your performance during popular segments. ‚Ä¢ Training Log & Best Efforts: Dive deeper into your data to understand your progress and set new personal records. ‚Ä¢ Group Challenges: Create challenges with friends to stay motivated together. ‚Ä¢ Athlete Intelligence (AI): Access AI-driven insights that makes your workout data easy to understand. No confusion. No guesswork. ‚Ä¢ Access Recover Athletics: Prevent injury with custom exercises tailored to your activities. ‚Ä¢ Goals: Set custom goals for distance, time or segments, and stay motivated as you work towards them. ‚Ä¢ Deals: Enjoy special offers and discounts from our partner brands. ‚Ä¢ Training Log: Dive deeper into your data with detailed training logs and track your progress over time. Whether you‚Äôre aiming for a personal best or just getting started, you belong here. Just record and go. Strava includes both a free version and a subscription version with premium features. Terms of Service: https://www.strava.com/legal/terms Privacy Policy: https://www.strava.com/legal/privacy NOTE ON GPS SUPPORT: Strava depends on GPS for recording activities. In some devices, the GPS does not work properly and Strava will not record effectively. If your Strava recordings show poor location estimation behavior, please try to update the operating system to the most recent version. There are some devices which have consistently poor performance with no known remedies. On these devices, we restrict installation of Strava, for example the Samsung Galaxy Ace 3 and the Galaxy Express 2. See our support site for more information: https://support.strava.com/hc/en-us/articles/216919047-Supported-Android-devices-and-Android-operating-systems
descriptionHTML:
Join over 180 million active people on Strava ‚Äì the free app where building community meets fitness tracking.

Whether you're a world-class athlete or just starting out, Strava has your back the entire journey. Here's how:

Track your growth

‚Ä¢ Record It All: Running, cycling, walking, hiking, yoga. You can record all those activities ‚Äì plus over 40 other sport types. If it's not on Strava, it didn‚Äôt happen.
‚Ä¢ Connect Your Favorite Apps and Devices: Sync with thousands of devices like Apple Watch, Garmin, Fitbit and Peloton ‚Äì you name it. The Strava Wear OS app includes a tile and a complication you can use to quickly launch activities.
‚Ä¢ Understand Your Progress: Get data insights to see how you're improving over time.
‚Ä¢ Compete on Segments: Show off your competitive streak. Race against others on segments to the top of the leaderboards and become the King or Queen of the Mountain.

Find and connect with your crew

‚Ä¢ Build a Support Network: Take the Strava community offline and meet in real life. Use the Clubs feature to join local groups or create your own.
‚Ä¢ Join and Create Challenges: Participate in monthly challenges to chase new goals, collect digital badges and stay motivated while encouraging others.
‚Ä¢ Stay Connected: Your Strava feed is filled with real efforts from real people. Follow friends or your favorite athletes and send kudos to celebrate every win (big and small).

Move with confidence

‚Ä¢ Move Safer with Beacon: Share your real-time location with loved ones for an extra layer of safety during your activities.
‚Ä¢ Control your privacy: Adjust who can see your activities and personal data.
‚Ä¢ Edit Map Visibility: Hide the beginning or end points of your activities.

Get even more with a Strava subscription
‚Ä¢ Discover Routes Anywhere: Get intelligent route recommendations with popular routes based on your preferences and location, or create your own bike routes and footpaths using our Routes tool.
‚Ä¢ Live Segments: Receive real-time updates on your performance during popular segments.
‚Ä¢ Training Log & Best Efforts: Dive deeper into your data to understand your progress and set new personal records.
‚Ä¢ Group Challenges: Create challenges with friends to stay motivated together.
‚Ä¢ Athlete Intelligence (AI): Access AI-driven insights that makes your workout data easy to understand. No confusion. No guesswork.
‚Ä¢ Access Recover Athletics: Prevent injury with custom exercises tailored to your activities.
‚Ä¢ Goals: Set custom goals for distance, time or segments, and stay motivated as you work towards them.
‚Ä¢ Deals: Enjoy special offers and discounts from our partner brands.
‚Ä¢ Training Log: Dive deeper into your data with detailed training logs and track your progress over time.

Whether you‚Äôre aiming for a personal best or just getting started, you belong here. Just record and go.

Strava includes both a free version and a subscription version with premium features.

Terms of Service: https://www.strava.com/legal/terms Privacy Policy: https://www.strava.com/legal/privacy NOTE ON GPS SUPPORT: Strava depends on GPS for recording activities. In some devices, the GPS does not work properly and Strava will not record effectively. If your Strava recordings show poor location estimation behavior, please try to update the operating system to the most recent version. There are some devices which have consistently poor performance with no known remedies. On these devices, we restrict installation of Strava, for example the Samsung Galaxy Ace 3 and the Galaxy Express 2. See our support site for more information: https://support.strava.com/hc/en-us/articles/216919047-Supported-Android-devices-and-Android-operating-systems
summary: Track your active life in one place and share the journey with friends.

scraped_reviews.content: Solid app, but most features have been slowly moved into the subscription so that as a free user, you are essentially just giving the company your data. Other basic fitness apps have feature parity with the free version now, so unless you're ready to pay I would explore alternatives. To add insult to injury, in 2025 they have sued Garmin with some patents that never should have been granted. The second any issue with Garmin linking occurs I will delete this and never use it again.

Used to work great, but after the recent update a couple weeks ago the app is no longer working. Keeps saying "an error has been corrected" when trying to record trips. The GPS, distance, speed, and routes are all inaccurate. Wish they wouldn't have tried to fix something that wasn't broken. It's also annoying that they're always trying to push the paid subscription on users, even though it offers only slightly more usable features vs the free app did before it became full of errors.

The GPS tracking is off at least 50% of the time I use it. It constantly cuts corners and sections of my route off. I know the issue isn't my device because I can record accurate routes with other apps. Just as bad, is there is no way to upload a gpx file on the mobile app, so if I want accurate routes, I have to record it with another app, export the gpx file, transfer it to a laptop, and then upload it from the web.

no optimized app for tablets. I bought a mini iPad to attached to my bike. I expected the app to be able to work in landscape mode, but only comes up as a portrait app in the center of the landscape mode. also, app is not very intuitive. so many things that I've tried to do, I have to look every time just to find what I'm trying to accomplish.

This app and the service in general is absolute garbage. I'm giving it one extra star as it has some basic niche utility. but it is highly unreliable. Workouts randomly disappear from the feed or, worse yet, will not appear at all even if they are able to appear on your profile page. people cheat by pausing for long periods and then resuming their workouts which can lead to faster paces than a normal experience. Features randomly go away. Customer service is AI slop. Don't reccomend.

I love Strava. It is super easy to use and I really appreciate how much stuff you can access while still staying free. However, the customer service is among one of the worst I have ever experienced. I payed for a full year of Strava Premium and due to some complications, my card got frozen. This cause the subscription to cancel. AFTER I had already paid for a FULL YEAR. I put a support ticket in nearly 3 weeks ago, and I have received no support for my issue.

Your app is making it difficult to delete my account. I only download for a specific reason but realized I didn't need too i owned a device that does this already. So every time I hit the delete account it keeps taking me out to your web page to enter my email and keeps telling me I have to log out first when I'm not logged in. And when I'm about to log in after I receive a code it does it all over again. can you delete my account on your end? This is getting irritating.

Good for tracking your activity. If you don't hit 'finish' DO NOT TRY TO EDIT the map/activity; it glitches or doesn't edit correctly. Support was of no help. Aside from that, be prepared to be bombarded with "free trial subscription" reminders/carrot dangles to view basic information that should be available without a subscription. I only use this app because a friend uses it and we can tag each other in if the other doesn't want to carry a phone.

Lately I've been having an issue that when I finish a run, it's giving me a time that isn't accurate. I'll do a run and get regular updates every 500 meters. My run will finish around the 40 minute mark and I'll finish the run, save it on the app and then when it's finished loading find out that it says I only ran for 25 minutes but that the distance was the same. It's only started recently, other then this small issue the app is awesome. But for now just 4 stars.

It records okay, though I have better luck recording with a different app and syncing it to Strava. You can't avoid all the ads for the subscription, and honestly, I don't think it's worth it for most people. The ability to share activities has also been ruined recently. Now instead of easy to look at maps and stats in a square format, you have all these vertical formats that look significantly worse. Why would you remove something so simple and liked?

Using it for years. It's "ok" as a social network for athletes. As software for training and tracking your performance, it is absolutely 1 star. And before, some of the data taken from accurate bike computers and power meters was significantly cut off without reason, but after the introduction of Ai, this is just terrible software. I hope someone else will soon appear who will push Strava out of the market.

I've been using Strava infrequently, sharing my activities with a few friends. But when I recently tried to use it to start recording activity, it interrupted me by displaying a message reading "Upgraded feature" and "Recording just got simpler." In my hurry and the bright outdoor sun, I couldn't find how to make the message go away so the app would start recording. So, Strava really failed here. I'll likely delete my account and uninstall the app. I'm glad I never paid for this junk.

strava is good at tracking your distance and pace, but that is where the benefits stop. There are constant ads for "premium" subscription which adds little, they push their spinoff app, there's endless background tracking and data harvesting, and now their flavor of "ai" is being marketed aggressively. Do yourself a favor and find a better app

I've used this app for years and recommended it to many athletes who didn't have it. Installed as a "free app" you get many notifications to subscribe, and gradually, features once free are being removed from the app for the "non payers" like using an emoji, often removes some of the text you write, or your route isnt always recorded as completed, prob a gps glitch. No big deal, they just want more revenue. Still the best sports for my people.

I just did a 26k hike that took me about 5-6 hours and it's been processing my activity for 20 minutes. this now marks the 3rd time and activity like this has an issue uploading to Strava servers. it doesn't even save the activity locally. I'm so pissed at this app. just download all trails. it's far superior and never has these issues ever, and offers a superior experience. don't be fooled by Strava being synced with everything. it fails to do the basic stuff like save your activities.

I really want to love this app. all the features and everything that it gives you is amazing. but the number one reason I use this app is to track my time and distance. I run with three different apps at the same time and Strava is consistently a quarter of a mile different from the other apps. my splits when running many miles is completely off from Strava as opposed to the other apps as well. no idea how to fix this I've tried everything on their websites. Fix this and do better!!!!!

App is good but I would love a way to add people as "friends" and a visibility setting for privacy for that. If most of your runs are outside you house and nearby you often don't want people to se that, but if its your friends or people you actually know then it often isn't an issue. The privacy/visibility setting has it set to either followers, only you, or everyone. I just wish for a lot of these there was a "friends" category.

The free version of the app is great. It connects to many brands of devices and gives me a way to interact with others who live farther away. Lately, the app has been offering a free 30 day trial. Like constantly, with a countdown timer. I'd be interested, except I can't actually sign up - the app just gives me an error message. So maybe the developers should make sure the free trial feature works before making a gazillion splash screens that don't work.

Useless. "Strava recovered from a problem" and loses half of my route. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. And yes, it had al permissions, battery saving disabled, yada yada. Unreliable, avoid like the plague. Even more garbage than Sports Tracker. 90%+ of my recent dozens of workouts randomly stop wrong in the middle, and I losing tracking. And I have all the battery saving settings disabled, all permissions given, yada yada yada.

Buggy & expensive. Currently in free trial period. The (huge) cost of a subscription would only be good value if the app was amazing, you use it loads & the fancy features useful. It's not, I don't, & they're not (for me). App constantly nags to get me to do things I don't want to do. In use (cycling), the map randomly resets from North-up to orientation-up, with no input from me, & is often 90deg out! I end up having to interact with little on-screen buttons when riding, which is dangerous.

New update, The continuing of cheating of e-bikes on segments, still a problem!! Not being able to see times while going up hill or down is cumbersome. I understand the safety aspect of it, but show us something towards the last couple hundred feet or so, so that we know when the segments ends. No notification of KOM's being lost, another annoying reason from Strava. It's not fun anymore ‚òπÔ∏è price hike. Everytime I click the app it goes to app info and won't go into the app.

I find Strava very helpful for keeping records of my runs and other exercise. I enjoy the social aspects too. Makes me feel like part of a community, even when I run alone (as I often do). The maps are helpful and the overview videos are fun. AI commentary can be helpful. I like that there is an option of the free or paid version.

Strava used to be the King of all running apps, but since they put most all their previously free features behind a monthly paywall, I don't rate it high at all & only maintain an account for the sake of keeping in touch with distant friends I used to run with. Strava is certainly not my go to running app anymore. I'd give it 1 & a half stars but it wouldn't let me so I gave it 2. Actually,No; I give it 1 star for screwing us skint runners over.

Run times not remotely accurate...or maybe I should try out for the Olympics? I've been using Strava for the last 5 years with consistent run times. 4 years with my current device. In the last 6 months my run times have been swinging +/- 2 to 3 minutes per mile. The app is basically unusable anymore. Hopefully Strava can fix otherwise I'll be forced to find a different fitness app.

WARNING...Maps, locations and times ARE PUBLIC unless turned off. I actually love the app and have been using it nightly on my rides to track my progress. What I didn't know was that anyone on Strava could see where I was riding and at what times. That presents a substantial danger to my safety. ESPECIALLY as a woman. When I turned those options off, I was informed that I could no longer participate in competitions. Well, my SAFETY is more important to me and SHOULD be more important to Strava.

Simple and effective community running app that is sorely missing certain effective tools and features. One of my biggest complaints has to do with the fact that when I do a run I want to see my "total time", but strava prioritizes "moving time". Another issue is just recently I had issues with GPS and my distance was stated to be 0.28 KM while my watch was indicating I went 1.80KM. I want to adjust the distance however I am unable to edit my activity. This is honestly frustrating.

The watch app is pretty much a fail. "Beacon" used to work on the watch, then it stopped working entirely unless a phone is connected to the watch. Strava support has ignored all of my requests for help. The data fields are not customizable, and the font is way too small. If Strava can't get this basic detail fixed soon, I'll be cancelling my subscription.

App is good and has some great features, but the subscription is expensive and the price-per-country just seems like price gouging to me. Also, can you take away the annoying "pay for pro" banners stuck all over the screen??? I know I can pay for a subscription if I have a lot of money to burn, you don't have to remind me every single ride.

Horrible app. It seems to only work if you take out a paid subscription. Despite it supposedly being able to import information from other apps it would not do so from my Garmin app. However the final deal breaker was when it wouldn't let me log in with my Google account went through the whole process of resetting the account and then it wouldn't let me in without presenting me with captcha visuals. I'm not stupid but after trying about 10 times I could never get past it.

Way, way, way too many notifications and emails without a setting to turn them off. Strava, I never (not ever) want or need kudos from the app or an email about someone giving a thumbs up. The interface, connections, and timeline are not intuitive and make me never want to use the app.

It was great, but recent changes have ruined the app. 1/ Zooming out of a map results in a white screen. 2/ Constantly having to put heatmaps back on, as the map keeps unselecting them. 3/ AI run reports are actually so bad. 4/ App never loads half the time. Come on, Strava, pull your finger out!

Strava has become aggressively paywalled, bombarding free users with constant trial prompts. I'm here to support others, not for features‚ÄîI use Garmin for that. Pushing deceptive trial tactics (like auto-charging users) is exploitative. This strategy risks alienating the very community that gives Strava its value. It's short-sighted and erodes trust. I'll leave if this continues.

It a good app, the problem is its consistently inconsistent. Just got back from a long walk and was excited to see how far I went before I found out that it messed up the GPS tracking yet again which was a massive disappointment. It keeps saying that power Saving mode causes the GPS to mess up, but I turned off powersaving for the app and it still messed up. Today I had plenty of battery, and it yet again messed up the route tracking. Good app, but no point using it if GPS doesnt work

Really annoyed with Strava for Galaxy watch. Especially when recording weight training, and then going for a run, it throws away the entire weight training session to start recording the run, even if the run was only 100 meters. I've lost so much training sessions because of this and there are no settings to control it. I've also had many recorded runs, where it never synced and the data disappeared into the nether realm. I am a paid subscriber, reconsidering my investment here.

I pay for the monthly subscription, and for some time now, I've been getting a notification that my premium subscription is about to expire, which prevents me from recording the Flyby properly without it obscuring the flight path. I'm paying, and they bother me with these notifications. So, I'm lowering the rating to 3 stars.

I've been experiencing what seems to be a really common issue. When I'm connected to WiFi none of my activities load correctly. I keep getting a "Network error: Please try again later" message. If I switch over to mobile data, activities load perfectly. Looking online, this seems to be a really common issue that has been known for years. How is it possible that something as annoying as this isn't getting fixed my Strava devs?

The app is constantly crashing if you setup a new device with Google account backup turned on. The workaround is to setup your device as a new one, install Strava and then restore a backup which for me is a no-go due to the long time it'd take to setup all other apps. The issue has been reported 2 months ago and it is not solved yet. As a subscriber I'm gonna consider my options as this is way too long.

Premium version AI insights are completely useless and it should be improved. I don't know what could AI insights say that it would be useful but please just fix it. For instance, AI echoes what I write in the title of the activity. Like, it says what I wrote back to me. What's the point?? Nevertheless, I am willing to pay the premium price because I like the app, there was a student discount and I generally like other premium features but please fix AI insights.

Terrible Customer service!! Have not been able to use my premium subscription for over 2 weeks. Reached out to customer service who just keep telling me the issue is fixed and going around in circles. Very Very unhelpful. I have uninstalled and reinstalled the app. logged out and logged back in and done everything else I can possibly think of but to no avail. If I could give negative stars right now I would. Even one star is too much for this service at present!!!!!!!ü§¨

Update in 2025. Started using it again in 2025. It's somehow worse. It requires huge amounts of memory to open so if you like spinning loading wheels then get this app. Additionally, nearly everything you click needs a premium subscription. End. I've used a few fitness trackers and this is by far the worst. Totally inaccurate records of distance and time. I've used the phone app and watch app. It also doesn't sync with other services well.

Strava was once a decent App and platform. Now they just increase the fees every year but add no value. The Swim fuction is still not able to be labeled as a "Race" but you can label it 'commute'. I don't think anyone commutes by swimming but I know a lot of people that race. Strava is no where near the value for what you pay. And it just keeps getting worse every year.

scammy practice; i did not subscribe and simply signed up for a trial, and i even took steps to ensure my "auto subscription" will be cancelled after trial, but i was still billed, not for a month but for an entire year's worth of subscription. I did not even use the app after just once. Submitted a request for a refund, they asked to clarify something and I did, and now the ticket is just left "Open" with "high priority" with no response after a week. I find this to be very poor service.

Just wanted to look at the app but that meant I had to sign up - so I did, but when I saw that it wasn't going to be right for me, I wanted to stop the free trial and cancel altogether. The chat box said I could delete my account and won't be charged anything - great, lets do that. Trouble is every time I went to delete my account, a box would pop up & I had to log back in again and then it would say it can't log in because I was still logged in??? I just want to cancel it and it's so confusing

The app used to be better. The wver encroaching paywall keeps eating away at all the incentives that make me want to use it. Guys like me just want basic tracking and recording for my own purposes. I don't need or want to pit myself against everyone else out there. It's a classic bait and switch gambit. If "meh" was a rating, that's what I would give it.

At first the app was really good. The times and distances appeared reasonably accurate. However the last couple of weeks the data for the distances has become ridiculous. For instance today I went for a walk for just under two hours. The app said I did 24.34kms - with a fastest split of 18 seconds per km. The Map for my walk had me going places nowhere near I actually walked. I don't know if there has been a new update but if there has been it has completely stuffed the app.

Terrible navigation and distance recording. Ive been using this app for 6 years and more than half of them has the wrong pace and distance... For example, yesterday's run which shouldve been a 5:30/km pace became a 6:20/km pace because of Strava's inaccurate rendering... This has been happening for YEARS, and has not been fixed yet... I know because I use other apps (Nike) and a smartwatch (Amazfit 5) which consistently showed accurate distance and pace

I pay for subscription and for over a week, I've not been able to use the app because it's so buggy after the new update. contacted Strava who basically said 'womp womp'. I've paid for five years because to get the leaderboards etc you need a subscription. they've amalgamated with Runna but that is a separate subscription. map feature has potential but doesn't work well. Limited options on the app (segment creation isn't possible for example) but you can't use the browser version on phone

It's an easy app to use. I use it when I do runs/events for charity and for just general, walking the dog. You do need to pay to use a better version of it but if you just track things, and don't use it for training towards something then it's fine. Would recommend it to other people. However, I wouldn't say it's worth the subscription for the better version, the free version works basically the same and there's not much difference between the two.

Utterly USELESS app. It consistently fails to record properly, missing out large sections of my run/walk despite the fact that my Google timeline records everything properly (therefore proving that it's not a problem with my phone, it's a problem with Strava). I'm going to uninstall it now because there's no point in having it, it just makes me angry and I don't want an app in my life that just makes me angry all the time because it fails to actually work!!

I generally like Strava (and I pay for a subscription) but I have noticed a recent increase in buggy behaviour. For example, if I share an activity such as a hike with a friend who didn't record then on their account it appears as a ride, and they need to edit it. There has also been a case where person I shared it with ended up with 4 for 5 duplicates of the activity. I fear Strava are loosing sight of what its users really want from the app - reliability before gimmicky new features please.

title: Zooba: Fun Battle Royale Games
description:
üî• Dive into Zooba: Epic Brawl Battle Royale - A Free Online Multiplayer Shooting Game!

Welcome to Zooba, the ultimate brawl battle royale game where you become a star by battling against online players in an intense multiplayer shooting experience. Ready, set, frag, and fire your way to the top!

üåü Key Features:
‚Ä¢ Free online multiplayer game for endless hours of fun
‚Ä¢ Fast-paced battle royale action with unique shooting mechanics
‚Ä¢ Choose from a variety of characters with distinct abilities and playstyles
‚Ä¢ Challenge your friends or play solo in intense battles
‚Ä¢ Level up and unlock new abilities to dominate the Zooba battlegrounds
‚Ä¢ Collect and upgrade weapons for devastating firepower
‚Ä¢ Compete in seasonal events and climb the ranks to become the top star

üí• Dominate the Zooba Arena and Become the Ultimate Shooting Star!

In Zooba, you'll join an online community of players ready for thrilling brawls and non-stop action. Discover unique characters and upgrade your weapons to unleash maximum frag and fire on your opponents. Whether you're a casual gamer or a battle royale enthusiast, Zooba offers a free multiplayer shooting experience you won't want to miss. Download Zooba now and become the ultimate star in this epic battle royale game!
