summary: Powerful notepad to capture ideas & save notes. Easily organize & share notes

scraped_reviews.content: This app has all kinds of features that really help to organize your notes, like importing or copy and paste. I like that I can change font size, type, color, and highlight. It even allows you to invent and change the background and style of the page. So many settings are offered to help you choose what makes you comfortable, and allows you to take notes more enjoyably. This app is very easy to figure out and use. I really like it.

OneNote mobile has improved much over the years. Problems syncing is still an issue, but not as frequent. Also there are some features I don't find helpful. 1) Not having a choice to open to your notebook list rather than recents. I can count on one hand the number of times I've used the recents page. 2) Moving pages takes you out of the notebook you're in to the notebook you've moved the page; this is only annoying because in mobile you can only move 1 page at a time.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry you‚Äôre having trouble with OneNote. We‚Äôve made some fixes to the latest version of the app. To get these fixes, please update to the latest version of the app from Google Play store. If you continue to have trouble, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com and we‚Äôll do our best to help.

scraped_reviews.content: Whenever I try to use the android app: *open app; see that the contents of my notes are out of date; wait several minutes; nothing happens; search around in vain for a manual sync; open and close app completely several times; give up*. Seriously, what's the point of keeping my notes on the cloud if the app literally never syncs? EDIT: years later came back to give a 1 star review for having to hard-close the app every couple minutes to reset its behavior. Totally inconsistent.

OneNote has been my note taking app of choice for almost 10 years. I left Evernote when the subscription started. OneNote may seem "old fashioned" when compared to Notion or Obsidian, but it's an easy program to learn and offers tons and tons of features without having to pay extra to unlock any. I've tried other note taking apps, but I always go back to OneNote after a week, or even a day! I do wish they'd update it more often, though.

I have hundreds and hundreds of notes. All of the sudden, they stopped syncing. I checked my OneDrive account and they're gone. All of them. What's really weird is that the one notebook I deleted is still there. Everything else has just vanished. Doesn't work at all with DEX. Lack of ability to alphabetize is ridiculous. Going to try ZoHo Notebook or Evernote, but one way or another I'm done with this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're having trouble with OneNote. Login to www.onenote.com to make sure your data is present in the server. If it is, please try to reinstall the app. If you continue having trouble, please send an email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com or send us feedback in the OneNote app by tapping "Send Feedback to Microsoft".

scraped_reviews.content: Good notes app, about as close as it gets to Apple notes for Android. Love that I can use markdown, group notes, attach files, share and export. Needs to be more stable (occasional crash) and the search option needs to let you search for each instance of search terms instead of just highlighting them. Also would be nice to linkify phone numbers like it does for url's.

Always loved the pc version. Sorry I used this on android and glad this is going away soon. Absolute garbage. Regular sync issues. No recovery of deleted files available on android app, which is exactly what you want on a mobile device which can unlock in a pocket or have a fauty touch screen. Sadly typical of Microsoft. I am upset enough to bail on MS across the board - windows, office, etc. If I accidently lose data on a free app, I at least didn't pay to lose it.

Not very functional for people who want something that is an actual note-taking app. Pages seem to be infinite and move around way too much. I wish there was a way to freeze everything and make it like actual folders and notes that are organized. It's not very ADHD or autistic friendly in my opinion. Every time I try to use it it moves all around. I want it to scroll up and down and that's it.

I have used many note apps, Keep became my go-to until I tried OneNote. Imagine digital spiral note books, one for each topic. Each page for certain notes. Now imagine being able to format your text, draw, insert pictures. Then start a new page within same notebook, or creating a new notebook for another topic. Finally instead of going through every page to find a note, you have the ability to search everything all at once. Take it from me, a heavy note taker, you want this to stay organized!

I have been using it to organize and D & D campaign where there are a lot of notes and a lot of sections. It took me a little bit of time to figure out how it worked but once I did it's been an excellent tool. The freedom to format my notes in an way and style is something I've really enjoyed. Plus the ability to have it conveniently on a mobile app on my phone is a big bonus

I have used several different talk-to-text apps over the years. This app has been the first one that has been constantly able to keep up. It is accurate, easy to use, and very user-friendly. It has never locked up on me while I am in the middle of writing or stopped dictating. This means so much when using it in writing in a flow state or at work because having to deal with glitches can cause the entire train to leave the station for those of us who struggle with focus at times.

I loved onenote until one day I was logged out and when I logged back in all my notes were deleted. I tried contacting support several times and no one was able to help. I was just told there must of been some sort of data corruption behind the scenes that deleted my files randomly and apparently there's no way of getting it back. I was devastated, I had almost a decade of notes in the app and now it was all gone with no reason as to why. Be careful using this app.

I really hate to give this app a one-star rating because it has some great features, and it worked in the beginning. However, it no longer syncs! It also keeps wanting to change the font to Calibri while taking a note, and after the note was already taken and saved. Maybe these problems are occurring because I use the app on Android. Even so, there is no reason why it shouldn't work. Especially when it worked fine in the beginning. Unfortunately, this app is no longer useful to me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're facing issues. Check the stability of your network and try syncing again, and make sure your data is uploaded on the server at www.onenote.com. If that doesn‚Äôt work, back up your data and reinstall the latest version of the app. If you have issues, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com

scraped_reviews.content: downgraded from 4 stars to 1 as my access to all my notes, even in read-only has disappeared. I suspect it's linked to the recent stopping support for the free one note version but on my laptop I have a paid-for onenote 2016 which I can still use instead for edits (utter pain to transition as I had to copy a lot of the pages manually as for some reason)... yet now the mobile isn't even seeing any of them. Relinked to the new (subscription) onenote only, possibly? Just killed it for me.

I was using Samsung note until they pushed an update that makes every number a hyperlink. Very frustrating when I work a lot with numbers. I switched to OneNote and everything was going great until recently I got a notice at the top of the app saying there is a conflict and that I need to open in a desktop computer to fix it. I don't have a computer. I'm the only person with access to my notes and only use my phone. How can there possibly be a conflict for syncing? I can't even fix it?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're facing issues. Check the stability of your network and try syncing again, and make sure your data is uploaded on the server at www.onenote.com. If that doesn‚Äôt work, back up your data and reinstall the latest version of the app. If you have issues, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com

scraped_reviews.content: I'm quite happy so far with how OneNote is performing. Not quite the same as Evernote, but I'm not enduring ads nor am I paying a high monthly subscription fee. I was able to copy & paste my notes from Evernote to this. the pictures did not go with, but that is ok. I figured that out. I don't understand the layout but I can get to my notes. It is now alphabetical where it wasn't before. I can also edit the notes or add to my current notebooks. I believe I will be deleting Evernote soon!

I absolutely love using OneNote. it has always been my favorite. I keep everything organized here. I basically turned it into my home filing system and then was able to include all my digital stuff too. It was more secure then google and when I needed a new note book for work or school or one of my children I was able to easily make one and assist my children when they needed it. FYI. if you ask me to review be prepared for the truth. üëç

I have been using OneNote for a long time, and I find the android version really terrible. You cannot get anything done over regular note taking, and it also has multiple issues. It lacks many essential features and it is hardly flexible. for example, every time I open it, all the grouped sections are open which makes it very crowded. You cannot create a new group section and you cannot change the theme of the app unless you change the system's theme! .. I feel there is a big room to improve!

I thought this would be a nice app to organize notes. You can create notebooks add sections, and write pages within those sections. Sounds like a nice multilevel organization! BUT you can't edit the notebook names. There's no function to return to the pages and continue editing them! Very unintuitive interface. OneNote seems really close to being useful, but is missing (or obsures) basic functions.

I looked at several digital notebooks in the past, and this is by far the best. It can be as simple as you like, and the structure of this notebook is only limited by the user's imagination. I've used it as a diary, keeping health records, lists of books to read, music to listen to, etc. I now use the 'sticky notes' as a place to record past memories before they go into my life story. ...a few more than I anticipated, but readily accessible.

Not quite as intuitive as Samsung Notes in terms of user controls, but not bad either. I really like this app and it is my go to now because of its export capabilities which is better than Samsung Notes. I can feed these exported notes to an A.I. of my choice and have the A.I. organize and export finished products based on these notes. Think: Taxes, or keep running totals on accumulated work time... or anything I want!

Its all good but it has some problems with syncing the notes, sometimes it just removes the new things I have added to the note just because it didn't sync, but everything else is just good. edit: I logged out and logged in again and found out that all of my notes have been removed and it tells me: (Cannot Open Page This page may have been moved, deleted, or you may have insufficient permissions to access it. Would you like to remove this preview card from Home?). so yes I'm leaving this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're facing issues. Check the stability of your network and try syncing again, and make sure your data is uploaded on the server at www.onenote.com. If that doesn‚Äôt work, back up your data and reinstall the latest version of the app. If you have issues, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com

scraped_reviews.content: Best journal I've yet to use. But The mobile version needs more improvement. Typing in Banga language In android or IOS is quite difficult. and the outlook could use some more attractive features or maybe a much cooler looks. Can't edit dates on mobile version that's a major issue. Still it's easy to use and very useful. Though I'll appreciate the mentioned improvement in the future.

Lack of features that would help with notetaking (lasso tool to select a portion of text or writing, and then the inability to change selected portion's drawing color by selecting a diff pen color). In other words, severe lack of features when compared to Apple's OneNote's and Microsoft's Surface Pro's OneNote's. Actually making me consider switching to an iPad Pro.

I use OneNote almost everyday on both my phone and my laptop. It is the most used app on my phone and I can't imagine not having it in my workspace. I use it for writing projects and keeping notes about everything from recipes to ideas about personal projects and journals. I only ask for more modularity and the ability to make low-level modifications inside of pages to make it perfect.

üìù Microsoft OneNote is your digital notebook on steroids‚Äîflexible, fast, and perfect for capturing everything from quick thoughts to full-blown research. üí°üìö You can type, draw, clip from the web, and organize with tabs and pages like a pro. üß†üìÇ Syncs across devices and integrates beautifully with Outlook and Teams. Whether you're brainstorming, planning, or studying, OneNote keeps your chaos in check. Organized, powerful, and always ready. üí™üìí‚ú®

While I love using OneNote, I am constantly prompted to sign back in because it's supposedly working offline. I've tried many solutions to no avail, and I'm not sure if this influenced by Microsoft Authenticator. When the problem happens, I end up with conflicts I need to sort out with the desktop version. It's a cumbersome experience. Please improve its performance and add features such as sorting. The Android version is a sloppy mess.

Not useful as a stand-alone app, and not that great even as a companion app to the desktop experience. It's just barely enough to get by on mobile - it doesn't do ink to text, doesn't let you move the containers, doesn't move horizontally (vertical only), doesn't let you do different tags (only one option). So with the mobile experience on Android was much better! OneNote and it's users deserve it.

One of the best note apps I've used. I like some of the new updates that have improved formatting and such, too. The only problem is that it doesn't allow searching on the individual notebook, section, or page level. Not sure why that is, but it it's one of the bigger weaknesses I've seen. Still, in every other way, it's great and fulfills all my needs for a mobile note-taking app.

Not much changed in 6 years since my last review. Cannot rename anything. Sync broke. The android app is still lacking basic functions such as select font and font size, indent, headers... Didn't wordpad in windows 98 have all that? It stinks I have to use the desktop or website on my phone to get all of the basic functionality. We need to end the idea that mobile device means less function! Its still a computer. This makes the android app mostly for read-only if using a PC.

Carried over from old iPhone to new Andriod perfectly. Android version seems slightly more intuitive, but that may be more my preference for Android than anything. A few small problems, like getting the cursor to place where I tap, are the only things stopping me from giving a 5 star rating. *edit Doesn't work with more than one device. If you log in one one device, others become "read only" or refuse to sync.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're facing issues. Check the stability of your network and try syncing again, and make sure your data is uploaded on the server at www.onenote.com. If that doesn‚Äôt work, back up your data and reinstall the latest version of the app. If you have issues, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com

scraped_reviews.content: I've used OneNote for a long time, but the Android app feature set is so minimal I need to migrate to a different primary note app. Moving pages to other sections or notebooks is clunky, and there's no option to move sections to other notebooks. My phone is the primary place I use the app, to read, write and organize notes. Needing the desktop to move things around defeats my purpose for the app.

Poor display layout, no indication it's syncing in the background (or foreground, for that matter), poor sorting capabilities, features lag way behind what's available in the Windows version, lousy display of page contents... If MSOFT isn't going to support OneNote on Android devices, at least open up the API so other developers can. Surely this app must be the shame of Microsoft.

This app became such a burden of a learning curve just to be able to use the stylus to scribble notes. Why devs? How is that ever practical? If not many people are using their stylus, so what? It should've been left alone, if it's not broken, don't fix it! The widget has no options to use the stylus to write down information. I would have to open then close the note and go to the bottom to choose the stylus option and then it will open a new note. This is ridiculous.

For the most part, the app is very handy - except for it seems to have a lot of trouble syncing accounts - which almost defeats the purpose of the app. Instead of actually syncing the notes, it merges them. Cannot resolve a page conflict from the mobile app - need to use a computer. Now I'm getting a message that says that the app can't sync because the servers are busy...?! Microsoft servers are too busy to sync a short list?! GARBAGE!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're facing issues. Check the stability of your network and try syncing again, and make sure your data is uploaded on the server at www.onenote.com. If that doesn‚Äôt work, back up your data and reinstall the latest version of the app. If you have issues, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com

scraped_reviews.content: some things are hard to use but other things are great. I can put in pictures and mark them up, which Keep cannot. when I put it on a new phone I don't know how to see all my notes as they were on my previous phone. it seems like I have to search for the note I any in order for it to be added in a spot for permanent access. it's just weird to navigate sometimes to w there in not sure where what is, unlike Keep, which is straight forward. Pin important things to the top and done.

OneNote has been a safe and reliable way over the years to keep notes of every variety handy when needed. Travel plans, medical records, and "here's how" notes are never mislaid. Recipes are handy while shopping. I put in visuals like drawings, photos or video links for info at a glance. The fact that Microsoft is growing the product keeps me loyal to OneNote.

I did a subscription for $9.99 option thinking I would be able to get my notes, but no. All I keep getting is an error message saying; "Cannot open page. This page may have been moved or deleted." I've been trying to contact someone about this, but I've had no luck calling or emailing. I'm really upset and I'm considering deleting this and getting a new app when I've been using OneNote for years.

I'm new to this app so I haven't been using it long enough to find stumbling blocks, but I have to say I'm really enjoying it. I find it works really well for my brain dumps and lists and to be able to modify things easily with things like check boxes and bullets points. It's really working well for someone that doesn't have the best computer skills. I hope I can set reminder notifications throughout the day for my lists to pop up. I don't know yet
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your feedback! For answers to your OneNote questions, see our Help and Support articles in the Account section of the app. You can also go to https://support.microsoft.com/onenote and select OneNote for Android at the bottom of the page.

scraped_reviews.content: The Bad : Syncing has a lag. Sometimes notes won't open if the sync fails. If this bug cannot be resolved. If this problem is not resolved, there is no purpose for this app. Good: -beats the competition *Better than Google Keep for not having character limitation as far as I know and good formatting options *Better than Evernote as it is free *Also linked to your Microsoft account
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry you're facing issues. Check the stability of your network and try syncing again, and make sure your data is uploaded on the server at www.onenote.com. If that doesn‚Äôt work, back up your data and reinstall the latest version of the app. If you have issues, send feedback in the app or send email to onandroidfb@microsoft.com

scraped_reviews.content: One other continues to be the standard in my opinion. It's strange that MS have yet to milk it for every monetization and enshittification opportunity they can find like they've done with the rest of their product line, but I'll take it while it lasts. Simple, multi-platform and free sync, multi-modal multi-input. does it all.

(10-30-2021) Can't find Sticky Notes. Installed Launcher and can only access them through that. Tried to update OneNote. It's current. Logged out and back in. Still does not show sticky notes as an option when I open the app from Android page. Works fine on my phone. Refuses to work on my tablet. (7-16-2022) uninstalled and reinstalled. Same problem. Running Android 10 on the tablet. It should work but isn't. Is syncing again on Windows and my phone. UPDATE: 3 years later and it's still the same
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for sharing your feedback! We‚Äôre actively investigating to see what it would take to address your concerns. We don‚Äôt have anything to announce at this time, but please stay tuned!

scraped_reviews.content: My go to notebook, I used to use a different one that started charging ungodly amounts to use, and had a lot of problems that were unaddressed for years. Tried this out and with a little bit of getting used to it, found it to be every bit as good and actually easier in some respects, plus it's free.

I've been using it for about a month now and pages are becoming incredibly slow. This app is simply not developed well enough to handle the note taking requirements of heavy courses. I attempted to export a page filled with around 50 handwritten homework responses, but neither the desktop version nor the android was able to do so. Fair warning: if you need to store long notes this app is not for you. Also note that there is a glitch where you're unable to title non-imported (e.g. pdf) pages.

Love OneNote and use it religiously and extensively for work and personal. Hundreds of pages in many notebooks. I don't expect the tablet version to be exactly the same as desktop, but simple things like sending from Outlook, sending a link or page from Edge, getting a link to a particular OneNote page, shouldn't be missing, these are all MSFT programs. They are great tools. Settings, options, and just general use on this tablet app are horrible. One star for this app, program itself is great.

I've been a super heavy user of OneNote, both personal & business,for many years on my Android phone, tablet & PC. It generally syncs fairly well, though about a year ago it suddenly made an entire 9mo of daily entries "unavailable." I've yet to figure that out. My biggest issue is since the beginning of 2025 (maybe before), it consistently crashes on my Android Phone whereas it never crashes on the Android tablet nor the PC. I've tried many solutions offered on the web-none helped. Suggestions?

Shows both active account based notebook and on device notes but fails in actually syncing notes to onedrive, doesn't allow you to move notes and doesn't maintain the organization that you have in your samsung notes, also consistently shows there are no notes. Support on the website isn't even close to sub par, it's almost like it's assumed the software will never have problems.

The concept is good, but the app is a mess. Maybe the PC version is better, but I don't use a PC. The notes are scattered all over the place. When you open the app, it should be listed by the notebooks. Adding a page is confusing. it just needs a lot of work. I know this app has been around a while, I thought Microsoft would have had it more put together. It feels cheap and amateurish. I hope they continue to update and improve it. We need a good note app.

Decent does the job done. Few more features from the desktop version would have been appreciated. Like highlight colour options, tags. Give option for people to add comment within your notes. Underrated note taking app can be polished further. Make collaboration more interactive than just a simple share and edit. Comments would be great. Timestamp inserts would be great from the desktop version.

I love using this app during classes or study sessions! One problem I have in this mobile version is that not all keyboard shortcuts can be used. It's frustrating to tap on my screen when I could've used my keyboard instead. I would like this app to have all of the keyboard shortcuts in this app similar to the PC version, like making my text bold by pressing ctrl+b instead of tapping it on my screen. Please add more keyboard shortcuts to make note-taking more convenient. Thank you!

title: Domino's Pizza USA
description:
Conveniently order Domino‚Äôs Pizza from anywhere on your Android phone or tablet. Build your pizza just the way you like it or choose one of our specialty pizzas. Add items from the rest of our oven-baked menu including chicken wings (traditional and boneless), pasta, sandwiches, bread with oven-baked dips, drinks and desserts. And with the Domino‚Äôs Tracker ¬Æ you can follow your order from the moment you place it until it‚Äôs out for delivery or ready for pickup!

Use the Domino‚Äôs Pizza app to order from restaurants in the United States, not including Puerto Rico. To place an order in Puerto Rico, visit www.DominosPR.com.

FEATURES: 

‚Ä¢ Create a Pizza Profile to easily access to your saved info and recent orders (not required)

‚Ä¢ Order your pizza faster than ever by creating an Easy Order!

‚Ä¢ Join Domino‚Äôs¬Æ Rewards and earn FREE Domino‚Äôs every 2 orders!

‚Ä¢ Pay with cash, credit card, debit card or Domino‚Äôs gift card

‚Ä¢ Use our voice ordering assistant, Dom, to add items to your cart and to select a coupon

‚Ä¢ Use Android Wear to track orders, or place an Easy Order or Recent Order right from your wrist

‚Ä¢ Use Domino‚Äôs Tracker notifications to follow your order until it‚Äôs out for delivery or ready for carryout!



APP PERMISSIONS: 
Location 
Precise location/GPS ‚Äì identifies your closest restaurants for easier carryout ordering

Phone
Directly call phone numbers ‚Äì makes it possible for you to call your local restaurant with a single tap within the app

Camera
Take pictures and videos ‚Äì used to quickly capture debit or credit card information at checkout

Photos/Media/Files
USB Storage ‚Äì required for upgraded Google Maps

Microphone
Record audio ‚Äì needed to enable Dom, our voice ordering assistant

Bluetooth connection information
Needed for integration with Ford Sync, Android Wear and Pebble watch

Device ID & call information
Read phone status and identity ‚Äì required as part of the Ford Sync feature, this is used if you want to call your store through Sync while your phone screen is locked


Other

‚Ä¢ Full network access ‚Äì this allows us to communicate with the Domino‚Äôs systems to provide you with the latest restaurant menus and coupons and it is needed to place orders from the app

‚Ä¢ View network connections - required by Google Maps, which we use to show store locations

‚Ä¢ Network communication - enables push notifications, giving you access to app exclusives, coupons and deals

‚Ä¢ Control vibration ‚Äì helps alert you to updates, like changes in order status as it progresses through the Tracker

‚Ä¢ Prevent phone from sleeping ‚Äì if you are using your voice to order, the app will prevent the phone from going to sleep (which would otherwise happen because you aren‚Äôt tapping the phone)
descriptionHTML:
Conveniently order Domino‚Äôs Pizza from anywhere on your Android phone or tablet. Build your pizza just the way you like it or choose one of our specialty pizzas. Add items from the rest of our oven-baked menu including chicken wings (traditional and boneless), pasta, sandwiches, bread with oven-baked dips, drinks and desserts. And with the Domino‚Äôs Tracker ¬Æ you can follow your order from the moment you place it until it‚Äôs out for delivery or ready for pickup!

Use the Domino‚Äôs Pizza app to order from restaurants in the United States, not including Puerto Rico. To place an order in Puerto Rico, visit www.DominosPR.com.

FEATURES:

‚Ä¢ Create a Pizza Profile to easily access to your saved info and recent orders (not required)

‚Ä¢ Order your pizza faster than ever by creating an Easy Order!

‚Ä¢ Join Domino‚Äôs¬Æ Rewards and earn FREE Domino‚Äôs every 2 orders!

‚Ä¢ Pay with cash, credit card, debit card or Domino‚Äôs gift card

‚Ä¢ Use our voice ordering assistant, Dom, to add items to your cart and to select a coupon

‚Ä¢ Use Android Wear to track orders, or place an Easy Order or Recent Order right from your wrist

‚Ä¢ Use Domino‚Äôs Tracker notifications to follow your order until it‚Äôs out for delivery or ready for carryout!



APP PERMISSIONS:
Location
Precise location/GPS ‚Äì identifies your closest restaurants for easier carryout ordering

Phone
Directly call phone numbers ‚Äì makes it possible for you to call your local restaurant with a single tap within the app

Camera
Take pictures and videos ‚Äì used to quickly capture debit or credit card information at checkout

Photos/Media/Files
USB Storage ‚Äì required for upgraded Google Maps

Microphone
Record audio ‚Äì needed to enable Dom, our voice ordering assistant

Bluetooth connection information
Needed for integration with Ford Sync, Android Wear and Pebble watch

Device ID & call information
Read phone status and identity ‚Äì required as part of the Ford Sync feature, this is used if you want to call your store through Sync while your phone screen is locked


Other

‚Ä¢ Full network access ‚Äì this allows us to communicate with the Domino‚Äôs systems to provide you with the latest restaurant menus and coupons and it is needed to place orders from the app

‚Ä¢ View network connections - required by Google Maps, which we use to show store locations

‚Ä¢ Network communication - enables push notifications, giving you access to app exclusives, coupons and deals

‚Ä¢ Control vibration ‚Äì helps alert you to updates, like changes in order status as it progresses through the Tracker

‚Ä¢ Prevent phone from sleeping ‚Äì if you are using your voice to order, the app will prevent the phone from going to sleep (which would otherwise happen because you aren‚Äôt tapping the phone)
summary: Order your Domino's favorites then follow the progress with Domino's Tracker¬Æ!

scraped_reviews.content: It is so easy to navigate, love how simple and hassle-free it is to navigate or switch between coupons! Domino's definitely has the best fast food app. I'm glad they added the "Pay @ store." I always use a card, but I'm glad for the option still. No other restaurants have it. I give a 4 because why do I have to restart my order when I close out of the app? I was literally at checkout, used another app, and had to start over. It would be nice if they saved your cart, at least that day.

Updated 7-5-25. Hasn't changed since last time you asked for a rating..Sells your email to other businesses. The fact that you have to go through three steps to opt out is completely ridiculous. My favorite part of this app is when it's busy they will turn it off. So you get to enter your order and when you try to complete it says store closed.. that's when I order from your competition. Which seems to be getting more of my money lately.

I like the Dominos app. There is one thing that I wish Domino's would do, be more transparent in pricing on the app. It would be nice to know what all the additional charges would be while selecting my choices. Like how much extra is each topping, or crust, or sauce, or even if you want extra cheese. Overall I like Domino's food and service.

Incredibly frustrating app. No prices are shown until something is added to the cart which is absurd. And say you decide you want a hand tossed crust after selecting a pan crust, you will have to manually remove the shredded provolone after or be hit with an extra charge. And the security code email to be able to order even though I'm logged in on *my* account on *my* phone just adds extra frustration to the process. For the insane prices nowadays (while still recycling cheese,) do better.

Super buggy after the most recent update. Errors in signing in, communicating with the store, following the tracker... oof. And on the tracker map, the pin for my delivery address is nowhere near my actual address. No wonder the drivers always call me completely confused and I have to manually talk them through finding my house. (I mean, it's not hard to find an address if you use your brain, but, okay).

Really a top quality app, accurate, easy to use and customize, tons of coupons and deals so you never feel ripped off. I like the tracker and personal feeling with the names and all that. I just got a random free medium pizza to use after an order I did for the heck of it. I only wished they showed the price for all items before hitting the add to order button. I'd prefer maximum transparency but it's not a big deal

The app is okay. It'll advertise discounted menu options, but when you get to check out, it'll seem like there was no deal (for delivery orders). Also, it doesn't let you tip drivers once the food has been delivered; you'll have to include tip when placing order (I don't under why--backwards!) Of course, you don't have to include tip with order and can hand the driver cash instead.

Great experience. Had no problems placing an order, and it sent without any problems. If I could recommend anything... It would be to show the prices of items before you add it to your checkout cart. I was gonna buy regardless... But I wasn't able to see any prices until I got to checkout. Still 5 stars. Curious to see future updates. OH!!! AND MAKE REWARD POINTS LAST LONGER!!! üçï

Everytime I go to place an order, I get an error and it tells me to call the store. the whole purpose of the app is to by pass waiting on hold by calling the store. This is an egregious way of running an app. for my last 6 orders I've had to use my wife's account because this app doesn't work on my phone. it's terrible, frustrating, and a huge waste of time. They charge me, the order doesn't get placed, and I have to wait over 10 minutes to recieve my money back.

Pros vs cons Cons -Aside from not knowing until check out what has extra cost when customizing or starting the order, it's pretty good. I dont like getting to checkout then having to edit my items. I would rather see a little warning that shows any extra charges right there before I add to order. The pros- Coupons are ready to add. Navigating the app is easy. Your points balance and order history is a click away. I like that I still can place an order because I am allowed to pay in store.

We've had so many issues with this app since moving to Tualatin, OR and continue to have problems since moving elsewhere. It keeps denying the order right at the checkout stage. We've had to re-enter our payment information and addresses several times to even get it to work at all. Also, charging a $7.99 delivery fee on top of a driver tip is too much. Only positive is the ability to change from delivery to pickup is easier now. You used to have to delete the entire order and start over to do so

Generally don't have too many issues with the app. It does what it need to I'm able to order a pizza and pay. Tonight I tried to order a pizza More than an hour in advance and for some reason it had tomorrow's date as default and I didn't notice. There was no way for me to cancel the order in the app. That's a major miss. I reordered my food for today and the store was able to cancel the future order. Please put in a cancel option.

The app itself functions fairly well; there are a few things that will hang up or glitch here and there but no more than (maybe less than) other apps. My hang-up is their "free medium pizza with your order next week". I very rarely order 2 weeks in a row. I might actually order pizza next month if I could use it, but because I ordered today, it will be another month or more before I order again. Would be nice to use it next month. The tease just irritates me, it does not entice me to come back

This app is fantastic, works well almost all the time, and makes it easy to place an order and track your order. My big complaint is that if you checkout and your payment doesn't go through, it wipes out your ENTIRE order and you have to start over from scratch and replace the whole order... Infuriating. Otherwise, fantastic app I'll keep using it for sure.

It is what it is. If you just want to put an order in and pick it up on the way home it's good, but that‚Äôs about it. The issue is that it updates constantly with no apparent changes to the app. I've yet to see new or improved features, but constant annoying updates. If these are for security, they fail. The only thing it makes me login for is to reorder one of my saved orders. Not to use my saved payment, not to make an order, just to access the ones I've saved.

The app is useful. It does not save gift cards for future use. That is really inconvenient. You can not use gift cards for a future order (a couple of hours out from our current time). Next time I want to place an order, I have to put the gift card & pin back in for my order. The prices are not always correct. When I try to use my debit card or PayPal to pay, sometimes the app sends the order, but it really didn't, so I have to restart my order entirely. Has happened several times to me now.

This app flat out lies to you about how long it's expected for your order to be made and delivered. My small order apparently wasn't even being made almost an hour after ordering it, even though the app said it would be 20-40 mins until completion of delivery. When trying to receive an order cancelation and refund, they won't even provide a confirmation of the cancelation unless you ask, and even then, I still have no idea if I've actually been refunded. Very shady and unprofessional.

Like others have commented on this and several other delivery apps, it gets into a loop of saving payment info, logging us out, and forcing us to start from scratch. Both times I've used it so far, it's taken a half hour to place an order because of this. Also, like others have mentioned, none of the prices pop up until you get the cart üõí Thankfully there's an easy remove button on each item. [EDIT] 03/30/2025 It's still giving me the same issues.

Veggies are hidden behind the meats menu. Constant requests to add stuff. Can't stand the ordering process with the app. Other pizza places do it better. I'll ask for no butter, and get butter. I'll ask for pie cut and get square cut. I think those options get overlooked when placing orders on the app, and it goes to the store. The app also constantly asks me to review it, so here you go...

Weird glitch with trying to use PayPal, after selecting payment method and clicking 'continue' in the opened browser window, this app just crashes 100% of the time. This has persisted across several versions, probably for years at this point... Also the app has no memory of 'draft' orders, so if you get mostly through adding things to your cart with lots of toppings and coupons and then if for any reason the app crashes or otherwise quits, welp now you have to start all over again.

Paypal checkout doesn't work. It will take you to the webpage and then redirects back where the app cant tell you finished and redirects you back, putting you in a loop. If you close out to exit the loop the app gets stuck loading and has to be closed. When closed, it forgets your order. I have been having this bug over a year. It also doesn't let me log in to an account in the app so i also have to re enter my info every time.

Kinda glitchy. Sometimes it won't link the store when choosing an address. Tracking works intermittently. This has been an issue for a while: When zooming in on the tracking map, it always displays the fully zoomed out map, showing the entire world instead of the local area. Not a big issue, it just doesn't seem like it's the intended result.

Used it for years and it's great! Very little problems and the ones I have encountered are either my own fault or easily fixable. Very easy to build my own custom Pizza and they give you a list of useful coupons right in the app. Great job on this. Edit: Store canceled my order due to being understaffed. App used points anyway. App doesn't have actual support. Takes me to a FAQ rather than providing support. I want my points back. You need real support before you get 5 star again.

I was always ordering on the website and finally just got the app. It works well and is pretty easy to navigate, add/remove/modify the order. My little mom and pop place got too expensive, $18+ for a one topping pie. They are good, but they put almost no sausage on it and got that price, skimping on the toppings means I'm not buying from them anymore. More food for my money with Dominos.

Apps fine and easy to navigate, but the delivery fee is too much with a tip for the driver. Hope they get a real wage since I'm sure they would be getting better tips if the company wouldn't have that charge. Also never tells you when anything added to an item raises the cost or affects the coupon. App is also predatory with trying to add items to order or donate, with the option to not do it in purposefully harder to see locations. Do Better...

Like it was designed in the 80's, trying to order and use any of the offers is just impossible! there's no notification if you invalidate the offer you've chosen at any point in the process and it's so difficult to add and remove anything. We always just end up spending more just through frustration. This means we order less frequently. it's a shame cause we love dominos pizzas but update the app!

Works as well as any app should. Nothing fancy. No bells or whistles. Simple and accurately does what it's made to do. I prefer the app as I'm not always a people person. Although any issues I've ever had have been fixed by calling the store. I usually have them deliver and I could rave on and on about the awesomeness of the drivers. Always very happy, very pleased. I'll continue to recommend. Domino's and the app.

This app is terrible! I haven't been able to order from this app for close to a year. When I go to place the order it says "an error occurred, try again later". so I do and it's the same message for every order, for months! which means I can't access online only deals... I like domino's, but they aren't getting any more of my business if it's going to be this difficult.

Best deals but worst app. App doesn't show a lot of the coupons. I also have to edit my phone number every order, because it screws up the area code and phone number itself. You also cannot use your points on the app, you have to go to the website. Website is also pretty bad, as there is no option to pay at store. This forces you to call, go through the automated system, and then you get transferred to a call center for the specific Domino's location. It's a long process, just to simply order üçï

The app will not remember my username and password, so I have to login every time I use it, and this has happened across several different phones, and for months, if not years. Tonight, it completely buggered up my order, and added toppings to one of my pizzas that I did not select, and removed one that I did, rendering it inedible. The store employees were great, but if I have anymore trouble with the app, I'll uninstall it for good.

Horrible experience, the app couldn't handle me adding Parmesan and red pepper flakes packets, so I was unable to get them. üò° I also hate that when you go to check out the different category options and you click on one it doesn't describe the menu item and then when you back out of it it brings you back to all the categories instead of the items you were looking at. Fix it!!! üò°

The app does not accurately show time remaining or the proper process, I can have someone say they delivered to my house but they never left the store. when ordering "unlimited toppings" they mean 7 and it glitches and can default to a cheese pizza. another annoyance is the constant upcharge offers trying to break coupons. I want a 6.99 2 topping pizza and it tries to ask "do you want bell peppers?" Other than those, the UI is excellent, the features are nifty and the memo is appreciated.

Sometimes buggy, but it gets the job done with not too much hassle. Does what it is supposed to do. October 25, 2025: it has a huge issue with checkout now. it tries to take my payment, but it then says there was an internal error, then cancels my order. I have to call the store and place an order instead of using the app, and have done so the last 5 times I've ordered.

Nice pictures of each item and easy to find what you want bcuz everything is pretty easy to find bcuz of the groups they're in and all the labels for each group are pretty easy to understand!! The one thing I didn't like is that when you order things like a salad or the cheesy bread, (which I did and usually do.....), and include them in the 2 or more for $6.99 coupon deal, it doesn't tell you that there's an extra charge for a dressing packet or dipping sauce to go with it so it's actually more

App almost made me order somewhere else. PayPal got stuck in an endless loop, so I had to close the app, and in doing so, it lost my order, so I had to start over. After starting over, I switched to using my credit card, which also gave me an error saying it couldn't save my card info, even though everything was written correctly. You're lucky your pizza is so cheap because your app is trash.

It's impossible to tell what part of your order breaks the coupon. By design. They make you too confused to use the coupon and just pay more. they could fix it, but they would make less, so they will not fix it. If you click a coupon, it lets you select items for the coupon that do not qualify. They are trying to trick you. It's an easy fix, but better to confuse your customers into paying more.

Very intuitive, easy-to-use, and fast. However, it bugs me that Domino's gives you 10 points regardless of the size of your order! if I order 20 pizzas, I still get just 10 points, the same as if I spend $15. Also, I entered a gift card last time I ordered and used about $4 of it, then pitched it thinking it would save to my profile just like my debit card. Nope! That means I lost $16. Talk about a bad day.

The app is frustrating. Orders rarely go through using my card, get multiple hits to my account when the order fails to go through. I'm not losing any money, but it looks that way to my account balance. That said, the changes and updates have made the app better and more functional. There are still issues with orders not going through to the restaurant, though I'm thinking that may be a volume problem because the app is pretty damn handy to order through.

Best thing about this app is the availability of offers and rewards. The ease of clicking what is essentially a "give me free stuff" button is awesome. I don't order enough to really get rewards, but on the occasions that I do order there have been offers like getting a free medium for placing an order that was more than $6, which is ridiculous and awesome.

Deleting this after 10 years. the app, despite updates, re-downloads, and conversations with my bank, no longer allows me to purchase orders. if I want to order, I have to go to the store or call it in, defeating the entire purpose of having an app account in the first place since all of the deals are in-app only. This has been an ongoing issue for more than a year and NO ONE is doing anything to fix it.

I like the availability of numerous coupons as well as the customization options for the pizzas. However, I do wish that customizations can be allowed for things such as pasta or salads. I wanted to add extra cheese to a salad or add extra sauce to a pasta dish, but was disappointed to see there were no customizations for those items. You already carry Alfredo and marinara sauce for the pastas and you definitely already have shredded cheese for the salads, so I figured it could be an easy add-on

Will error without any helpful information, such as anything being wrong with the saved card you're attempting to pay with. Upon attempting to save the card to your profile with updated details, it won't let you. Can eventually order pizza, and selecting menu options is convenient, but frustrating if anything isn't set up perfectly on your payment.

I had to repeatedly enter my name, email, and credit card info. The first time it happened, it's annoying; the 2nd time it happened was extremely frustrating. It said I didn't have a Profile, but when I tried to create one, it said Email Already Exists. I honestly don't know if I'll use Domino's for pizza the next time I order - it was THAT FRUSTRATING! Please fix this app. Thanks

Update: New Version of this app NEVER works! It glitches and will not place an order. You have to uninstall/reinstall it to get the older version which does work. App is fast to order from! Very easy to use, menu is simple to navigate, deals are obvious, and prices are super easy to find. Love it.

The interface is solid, and maybe I'm just unlucky, but every few months when we decide to order Domino's, I always have issues. There is almost always an error when I go to place the order, and you need the patience of a patron saint when going to checkout and dodging upsells while also waiting for it to load. In 2025, there's no excuse for an app to be this slow when checking out and "sending your order to the store".

I would suggest waiting at least 30 days or 10 orders before spamming the rate this app pop-ups. Was kind of annoyed that I have barely even used the app for 30 minutes, and only looked at 1 page of the menu, and was getting that pop-uphit me left and right. I saw more surveys than I did food that Iwas attempting to order. I get it, with all the changes being made in business to adapt, knowledge is crucial..I wouldn't want anyone's opinion on something they barely had time to look at or understa

App is easy to navigate, but when you use coupons, charges start appearing that don't make sense. For example, different sauces will charge you extra but it doesn't tell you that. Using Alfredo increased the price +$3, but nowhere does it warn beforehand like with crust options. I wish you could also add topping/sauce extras for pastas. Your delivery charge of $8 is rediculous. I'd rather give that to the driver instead of a charge AND tip. Your overall pricing for fast food pizza is redic.

Hoping a 1 star review will get them to notice. App is pretty user friendly and I use it often. However, when it comes time to place the order, there's a bug that prevents the order to go through. When I call the store to place the same order, they tell me others have complained about the same issue. Should be a simple fix dominos. If I cant finish placing my order, the app is completely useless. Please fix ASAP

supposed to get a free pizza with my 60 points, but it keeps trying to charge me 15! Even more begging for ratings. Slow app and the store can't seem to ever get the order right, but because I used the app, I have to drive to the store to fix the order, they won't re-deliver the correct order and want me to bring back the defective product to prove it. Just lost a star for begging me to rate yet again!It's functional and easy. Getting sick of being asked to rate it when I already have.

App was slow, doesn't save anything, and kept crashing. I had so much trouble with paying, password wouldn't work even after I just changed it, I had to order the same pizza 7 times because my cart was never saved, and it took over 3 hours to actually get the pizza ordered, and that doesn't include the 3 other days I have been trying to order the same pizza this week. I hope it actually arrives!

title: AMap Global
description:
China's first English map for overseas users has officially launched!
The Choice of 800 Million Navigation Users.
Over 200 countries and territories mapped and hundreds of millions of places on the map.
Exploring China with AMAP as your guide!

-3D lane-level views & traffic light countdown
-Get real-time traffic updates & ETAs
-Detail junction views, never miss a turn
-See real time transit info and route options
„ÄêAPPÊõ¥Êñ∞„Äë
-3D lane-level views & traffic light countdown
-Get real-time traffic updates & ETAs
-Detail junction views, never miss a turn
-See real time transit info and route options

summary: Navigation,Traffic,Bus & Train

scraped_reviews.content: When I try to add an emergency contact, the app refuses " " space character which is needed for international names. I typed my wife's name and I cannot press Accept. Also power consumption on iPhone and android is really bad, uses half the battery in 2 hours. Maybe from GPS usage. Phone gets hot. I cannot find a place to report issues inside the app. I accidentally bother the taxi support team to report these issues, I am sure they aren't happy.

It's one of the major Navigation and map app in China. It does have offline map function. However, I guess if you download it from Play store, you're not going to be able to use it in China when you are actually offline or out of signal, which is hilarious. Also, the main page of this app is like a rocket launch control room control panel. I bet it does have 10,000 plus function, but none of it is going to help you navigate to any of the destination you want to go.

The app needs some improvement for user outside China. I can't register the account using my phone since the app can only recognize China's moble phone number. Also, when setting the street address for navigation, thr app doesn't really recognize the street name and city. I tried several times and find it better to use shop, company, or tourist attraction nearby for finding my destination. But the navigation is pretty good after correctly setting everything.

This app is the only English map that works in China on Android. Unfortunately it requires a Chinese phone number to use and loses many functions in English. Binding Wechat, Alipay, and Taobao can't bypass this login requirement. It's reasonably straightforward to get a SIM card linked to your visa before you even arrive, but not worth the hassle for shorter trips. I wish it just kept the same interface and search settings as the Chinese versions and didn't require a local phone number to login.

Useful map, and good that they finally added English but language support is still lacking in general. Most annoying is that it insists on me adding my phone number to use anything beyond the most basic functions. Why do you even need this? It's a bit creepy! Not only that but the list of countries that it will accept phone numbers from is super limited and it won't allow mine. Could be a good app if you didn't insist on collecting people's private data and just make a map.

Edit: the solution is to sign in via email, and just select one of the listed countries. Doesn't allow login except with phone numbers from a couple of countries. Even though there are other login methods it will still ask for a phone number. Sadly it's nusable without it.

It has an English translation now but the app still sucks. You can't save destinations or log in with Alipay, since you need to verify a Chinese phone number in Amap. Renders most features unusable for tourists. You can however still use the destination planner without an account.

2 stars for being better than nothing in China and sometimes working. But: terribly unreliable. Arrow never points in right direction. Often can't find an address and gives you seemingly random places to choose from.  Sometimes suggests bus routes that don't exist. Worst fail: sent me on a 2 hour journey from a railway station to my hotel including walk along a highway and sending me through a prohibited area (a guard stopped me). The way back took 35 mins.

After the update, during the National Holiday and Autumn Festival the English navigation voice was not working, making navigation for us as foreigners extremely difficult. Please make the voice navigation available again. It was fixed and it's definitely the best navigation app for China
the app has amazing potential but in Riyadh Saudi Arabia there are many missing features. no transit,no biking, and only bolt in for taxi. other then this it's quite buggy very far from smooth.

the application is good, but people in middle east countries cannot log into the application using their mobile number, and Gmail account is not enough to get application full functionality, so it should be updated to accept mobile numbers like for Jordan. also this hinders linking it to the cars like BYD cars.

This app lacks behind any other map I have ever used. UX is just a nightmare. The information like the existence of shops rarely reflects reality. If you traveling china and just need navigation any app using open street map is better
it keeps asking for a phone number when I'm trying to search stuff !! And i can't add one because Finland isn't on the list...I need a working map for China trip..

Well, my brother told me this, and I found it's much better than Google Maps or other similar mapping things. Any traffic things can be shown and appeared on it please? Thank you so much you all the developers team!
Best maps, at some features, it can even beat Google maps. I especially like the transport option and trainline/ bus details, love it.
Petal Map randomly failed on my Chinese phone so I opened this on my Oppo and wow it just works. Thanks Developers this is awesome. BTW - You need a Chinese SIM or nothing works.
finally! can you put dark mode on the map though. It's the only English friendly map app in China, good progress in the right direction
can't use it with a French number. only limited countries available. can even link it to Wechat , Alipay nor email ,so why proposing this login option ??!!

only map app that caters to english speakers in china but you can't read certain locations without an account which you are locked from making as an american... but its good and helped me out a lot in china it is also used by locals the most from what ive seen. works with poor service surprisingly well
This app is completely useless as it does not allow me to enter my UK phone number, despite supporting Englishüòê

Generally decent maps - plenty usable to help for non-chinese speakers get around. It's incredibly annoying that it constantly asks you to sign in - with a Chinese phone number. Even though you can theoretically sign in with wechat or Google, you still need a Chinese phone number to get to the next stage. It would be better if there was an option "Stop trying to sign in - because I can't."

Not usable for US: I travel to China regularly, so was excited to try this. Unfortunately, after downloading, I was unable to log in through email, phone, orWeChat, just kept getting "unsupported" messages. US is not a country listed in the app. don't waste your time

The email login option is available, but the app is still asking for a mobile number, which doesn't seem to work. Could you please check this issue or simplify the login process for a smoother user experience?
Excellent lane guidance. App is visually pleasing. Won't miss a turn with this app.

it's a great app for foreigners to go explore mainland china. but I can call a taxi on this app. coz I don't have china phone number, it must be wonderful if we can register with foreign phones numbers and can contract a driver via the internet.
works great. someone comment that they couldn't log in. no need to log in. it now supports English. previously only worked for China but I see even has the map for the US.
only usable if you have a phone number from one of 12 countries. Europeans or Americans can't use this app without buying an Asian sim-card
i cant login with phone number because the verification code is not sent to me. i try it so many many time but it didnt work at all. please fix this.

It doesn't show the highway bigger size, it should also show me the line on the highway. Everything should be bold and bigger and clear, it doesn't show earlier, the direction should be more work on it.

scraped_reviews.content: Stops working unless you have a phone number from a small list of countries Edit: navigation works still, but it'd very cumbersome
phone number cannot bind, keep on trying keep on not working. so disappointed
this map is good,but i lost the voice assistance and 3D lane assistance, anyone experiencing the same?how you guys fix it
it's good for mainland China, but do not use it for hong Kong it's a disaster!
Must have for anyone traveling in china, there you can experience the full function and accuracy , and good to have for anyone who likes to try a different navigation approach.
It asked if I want Chinese or English. I chose English. it gave me Chinese with no way of getting back - maybe if you could read Chinese... I reinstalled to make sure I did it right. Same result.

unable to use without having a Chinese phone number... wanted to plan my trip but I'm not able to do any search without being prompted with a login page and it's impossible to register without a Chinese number....
A good app especially for travelling in China but the main issue is we can't login without a Chinese phone number. i hope you can improve the issue.
Same issue as the rest. Suddenly stops working, "no internet" demands login, but no European login options.
Main problem is links don't open in the app. When I share a link, it opens in the browser and starts to download the APK again.
Your apps are not suitable for Bangladesh. I request you to update them quickly.
keeps asking for a phone number but only allows limited country. it keeps popping up and I don't want to log in.

We need app in fully English version, in all views and setting. And, also in navigation voice in English. We need live chat with Amap staff, support hotline phone number and email too. Rightnow English language is not supported yet. China has many foreigners too and why not let app use in English and also we want your voice AI girl Xiao de speaks in English too.
Appreciate if it's able to support Android auto.
just started to use this morning, noted once I loss the way. this Apps unable to respond and reroute. hmmm...very weird
it was a good app but it seems to have lost its voice?
The latest version no longer lets you use this application unless you have a china mainland phone number which is so ridiculous . bye bye amap .
The best map for traveling.

I don't have to sign in nor register to use. May be they've updated not to. It's working and smooth. It also provides the routes using car, public transport, on foot in English, like Google map. So far, looks good as Baidu map in English. Thank you. It's so handy as I have non Chinese speaking friends who travel to China with me.
It's lagging now. Please do something. The app becomes so slow.
The best map to be used in China.
